body_html:
@apaszke Running python setup.py develop did not work for me in a virtual environment (venv, MacBook Pro, macOS Sierra v 10.12). Python couldn't find any torch modules (ImportError: No module named 'torch.nn'). TBH I don't know why.

However, installing a dev version with pip did the trick for me (source):

# git clone ...
cd pytorch
export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.11 # instead of suggested 10.9
pip install -e .
body_text:
@apaszke Running python setup.py develop did not work for me in a virtual environment (venv, MacBook Pro, macOS Sierra v 10.12). Python couldn't find any torch modules (ImportError: No module named 'torch.nn'). TBH I don't know why.
However, installing a dev version with pip did the trick for me (source):
# git clone ...
cd pytorch
export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.11 # instead of suggested 10.9
pip install -e .
body:
@apaszke Running `python setup.py develop` did not work for me in a virtual environment (venv, MacBook Pro, macOS Sierra v 10.12). Python couldn't find any torch modules (`ImportError: No module named 'torch.nn'`). TBH I don't know why.

However, installing a dev version with pip did the trick for me ([source](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15031694/installing-python-packages-from-local-file-system-folder-with-pip#answer-20043907)): 
```SH
# git clone ...
cd pytorch
export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.11 # instead of suggested 10.9
pip install -e .
```
